title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Red Sox's Alex Bregman advises teammates to slow down and execute better as the team aims for postseason.
Boston holds the American League's second wildcard spot with 13 games remaining, needing strong performance to secure playoffs.
Bregman hits first home run since August, remains key player with .279 average despite recent slump.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution tied Toronto FC 1-1 at Gillette Stadium, with Luca Langoni scoring a 90th-minute equalizer.
Revolution remain 11th in the standings, narrowly avoiding playoff elimination after Chicago's 3-1 loss to New York City FC.
18-year-old Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start, impressing with his calm and confident performance in central midfield.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora advises against focusing on playoffs too early, despite being in a wild-card spot.
Red Sox currently hold the second American League wild-card spot, trailing the Yankees and Blue Jays in standings.
Boston faces a tougher schedule compared to Texas, with multiple series against playoff-bound teams remaining.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow, Red Sox chief baseball officer, is prioritizing hiring a new general manager this offseason.
The general manager role has been vacant since Breslow's 2024 hiring as head of baseball operations.
Candidates from within the organization include Raquel Ferreira and Eddie Romero, both current assistant general managers.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints, receiving a 2027 sixth-round pick in exchange.
Polk, drafted 37th overall in 2024, struggled with performance and injuries, leading to his departure.
New England also sends a 2028 seventh-round pick to New Orleans as part of the trade deal.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots aim to end a five-game losing streak against the Dolphins in Miami this Sunday.
Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel faces pressure after a 33-8 loss to the Colts in Week 1.
Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa holds a 7-0 record against the Patriots since being drafted.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a Southern Gothic themed concert at Boston's Roadrunner venue on September 12, 2025.
The setlist included songs from 'Willoughby Tucker, Iâ€™ll Always Love You' and featured the narrative between Cain and Willoughby.
Jae Matthews of Boy Harsher joined Ethel Cain for a duet, enhancing the evocative and immersive performance.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior,' a film about a 59-year-old man's return to college football.
A Boston screening of 'The Senior' will be held on September 14, featuring a Q&A with Chiklis at AMC Boston Common 19.
Directed by Rod Lurie, 'The Senior' releases nationally on September 19, co-starring Rob Corddry and Mary Stuart Masterson.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Forbes' list of 400 richest Americans includes nine residents from Massachusetts ranked between 27 and 382.
Abigail Johnson of Fidelity Investments, with a $35 billion net worth, is Massachusetts' richest, ranking 27th nationally.
Patriots owner Robert Kraft is the 78th wealthiest American, owning assets including the New England Revolution team.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lost to Yankees 4-1 at Fenway Park, managing only two hits and three errors in a sloppy game.
Lucas Giolito pitched 5.2 innings, giving up two runs, but Boston's offense failed, going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position.
Carlos Narvaez's catching errors contributed to the loss, extending innings for Yankees and allowing them to capitalize.
